snippet: The Defense Secretary and chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff said the United States would sustain a strategic partnership with Afghanistan after the NATO mission ends in 2014.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta and Gen Martin E Dempsey, Pentagon's top civilian and military officials, express an expectation, and even a desire, that American troops remain in Afghanistan after the NATO mission ends in December 2014; say no final decision on troop withdrawal has been made.
lead_paragraph: The Defense Secretary and chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff said the United States would sustain a strategic partnership with Afghanistan after the NATO mission ends in 2014.

headline.seo: Pentagon Expects to Keep a Presence in Afghanistan
headline.main: Pentagon Expects U.S. to Retain Presence in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Expects to Keep Presence in Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
